node.title: 'Terrible time' to be restructuring health sector says National's Shane Reti
node.description: The National Party says it's no wonder the health workforce is burnt out with most District Health Boards missing the agreed deadline to improve safe staffing. Audio
node.content:
["The National Party says it's no wonder the health workforce is burnt out with most District Health Boards missing the agreed deadline to improve safe staffing.", "", "
National Party health spokesperson Shane Reti. Photo: RNZ / Samuel Rillstone
", "In 2018 the DHBs settled on a collective agreement for nurses, midwives and healthcare assistants with the complete implementation of a 'Care Capacity Demand Management' programme - a set of tools to ensure there are enough staff on shift.", "National's Health spokesperson Shane Reti received confirmation from a written Parliamentary question that only one DHB had met the target by the deadline six months ago.", ""Leading up to coronavirus there was very slow progress.", ""This was specifically to reduce some of the risks around nursing staff being overworked in DHBs," he said.", "Just Northland DHB has 100 percent implemented Care Capacity Demand Management by the cut off - five were close at more than 90 percent.", "The two worst DHBs were Canterbury at 49 percent and Waikato at just 34 percent.", "In the response, the health minister's office stated Canterbury and Waikato were late adopters of the CCDM programme.", "The Waikato DHB's roll-out was then further delayed by the cyber attack last year.", "Reti said now is not the time for expensive reforms of the health sector.", ""When the sector is already struggling for workforce, struggling to keep up with demand, even before whatever Omicron may bring towards us, this is a terrible time to be restructuring the sector," he said.", "A government spokesperson said Minister Andrew Little has made it clear his expectation is that all DHBs continue to implement CCDM.", ""While many have made good progress to implement it, several are behind for a variety of reasons, and the Ministry of Health is working with them to ensure CCDM is implemented as soon as practical," they said.", "As of September, Waikato has increased its implementation to 42 percent and the acuity tool as part of the programme is being used to share staff across wards.", "The DHB said it was aiming to have the programme fully implemented by February, but this has now been delayed due to Covid.", "Staffing continued to be an issue, but staffing numbers has increased in some wards and emergency department, it said.", "Canterbury's Midwifery and Maternity Services executive director and acting nursing executive director, Norma Campbell, said the DHB is closer to meeting the 100 percent target.", "She added the four components of the CCDM programme have all been rolled out across Canterbury DHB.", "On staffing, the DHB said national shortages of nurses and midwives have been compounded by the border closures.", ""This means we have to adapt and flex resources to meet demand, with some staff regularly picking up additional shifts.", ""We have an active recruitment programme underway for these vacancies including talent sourcing from overseas, multi-channel advertising across all job boards, targeted campaigns, recruitment open days and attendance at Career Expos," she said.", "Midwifery Employee Representation and Advisory Service (MERAS) spokesperson Caroline Conroy told Morning Report hospital midwives are burnt out not because the CCDM had been delayed in implementation, rather there had been underinvestment in training and support in the past 10-15 years.", ""It's pretty tough actually on the wards at the moment. For many of us who have been in the health profession for a long time, it's probably the worst we've ever seen.", ""There are some maternity units where they can barely roster one or two midwives on for a shift for the entire maternity service. It's pretty terrible.", ""One of the other things that came out of the 2018 MERAS settlement with the DHBs was the midwifery accord, which has been producing some good initiatives that will support the recruitment and retention of midwives in the DHBs.", ""But it takes four years to train a midwife so you're not going to see changes overnight.", ""If we had been doing that work 10 years ago, we wouldn't be in the situation we are in today."", "She said she supported the CCDM because it provided objective data on the number of staff required on wards and units.", "The government has also provided funding for wraparound support for Pasifika and Māori student midwives and more funding for a general hardship fund for students, she said.", ""We just now need to make sure that those careers are seen as attractive options."", "The next report is due later this month."]
